org.pathvisio.paver.construct

Class Constructor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pathvisio.paver.construct.Constructor

  • public class Constructor
extends java.lang.Object
    Constructor class.

    Class that takes care of putting the nodes and edges on the screen in a structured manner

    Author:
    Christ Leemans

      • Constructor

        public Constructor(org.pathvisio.core.model.Pathway pwy,
           org.pathvisio.core.data.GdbManager db)
        Create a new constructor
        Parameters:
        pwy - The current pathway
        db - The GdbManager

      • Constructor

        public Constructor(org.pathvisio.core.model.Pathway pwy,
           org.pathvisio.core.data.GdbManager db,
           boolean newpwy)
        Create a new constructor
        Parameters:
        pwy - The current pathway
        db - The GdbManager
        newpwy - boolean representing if it's an empty pathway. If not, new nodes should be added on the right side of the already existing ones.

    • Method Detail

      • plotConnections

        public void plotConnections(java.util.List<Connection> connections)
        Plot connections on a pathway, if there are lots of connections, they are plotted in separate columns
        Parameters:
        connections - List of connections

      • plotConColumn

        public void plotConColumn(java.util.List<Connection> connections,
                 double j)
        plot a single column of connections
        Parameters:
        connections - List of connections
        j - number used to calculate the location of the nodes on the x-axis

      • plotNodes

        public void plotNodes(java.util.List<Node> nodes)
        Plot nodes on a pathway, if there are lots of nodes, they are plotted in separate columns
        Parameters:
        nodes - List of nodes

      • plotNodeColumn

        public void plotNodeColumn(java.util.List<Node> nodes,
                  float j)
        plot a single column of nodes
        Parameters:
        nodes - List of nodes
        j - number used to calculate the location of the nodes on the x-axis

      • setStartX

        public void setStartX(int x)
        set value to start the calculation of locations on the x-axis. In case of a new pathway it should be the centre of the pathway window. But if nodes/connections are added to an existing pathway its the starting point of new node creation.
        Parameters:
        x - integer value to start the calculation

      • isBothWays

        public static boolean isBothWays(org.pathvisio.core.model.LineType lt)
        check if the line-type should be displayed on both the start and end side of the connecting line. If not, the line-type is displayed on the end side of the line.
        Parameters:
        lt - a line-type
        Returns:
        True if both ways or False if not
